Interface com.chimu.form.query.QueryVar

public interface QueryVar
extends QueryExpression
A QueryVar is the basic variable in Queries. A variable takes on values during the evaluation of a Query and can be used to restrict the queries results (when used in a condition) and to specify which values are desired (when used as the result value).

The main QueryVar subclasses are ExtentVar and AssociatedVar (aka SlotVar).

See Also:
ExtentVar, AssociatedVar

Method Index

name()
slot(Slot)
Deprecated.
slotNamed(String)
Create a new QueryVar by creating an AssociatedVar (SlotVar) that is connected to this QueryVar through the named slot.
valuesRetriever()
The ObjectRetriever (Type) for the values that this QueryVar will select over

Methods

name 
 public abstract String name()
valuesRetriever 
 public abstract ObjectRetriever valuesRetriever()
The ObjectRetriever (Type) for the values that this QueryVar will select over

slotNamed 
 public abstract AssociatedVar slotNamed(String slotName)
Create a new QueryVar by creating an AssociatedVar (SlotVar) that is connected to this QueryVar through the named slot. All QueryVars supply this method but it is only valid if the object has a slot with the slotName specified. Non-slotted QueryVars will fail for all slotNames.

slot 
 public abstract AssociatedVar slot(Slot slot)
Note: slot() is deprecated. Use slotNamed instead.
